intro: Ingenhouzia triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its compact growth habit and small, fragrant flowers. The plant features trifoliate leaves with three distinct lobes, giving it its scientific name. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, often found in rocky or coastal environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
